Over more than 35 years of touring and recording, Alejandro Escovedo has played punk, rock, folk, country, and Latin music. But no matter the style, EscovedoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s songs tend to default to a dreamy drone. Sometimes Escovedo plays loud, with wildly reverberating guitar and rattling drums; sometimes heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s more muted, sticking to the soft hum of a violin or cello over acoustic guitar. But Escovedo is a cool customer regardless, singing in his pleasantly raspy voice about a life spent on the road, watching people and places slip past him. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s an effortlessness about EscovedoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s songs, such that listeners could easily miss that heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s singing about desperate folks in desperate situationsÃ¢â‚¬â€and that sometimes the desperate person is Escovedo himself.
